===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くつ}}
Unclear. Some Japanese sources suggest a borrowing from or cognate with Korean {{ko-l|구두||shoes}}, but then some Korean sources suggest that the Korean term was borrowed from Japanese {{lang|ja|靴}} (''kutsu'', “shoes”).

This reading is more commonly spelled as {{ja-l|靴}}. See that entry for more detail.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くつ|acc=2|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|dev=1}}

====Noun====

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=くつ|靴}}: [[shoe]], [[shoes]], [[footwear]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わらじ}}
{{IPAchar|/waragut͡su/}} → {{IPAchar|/warand͡zu/}} → {{IPAchar|/warand͡ʑi/}} → {{IPAchar|/warad͡ʑi/}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=わらじ|藁|tr1=wara|t1=straw|靴|tr2=kutsu|t2=shoes, boots, footwear}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

This reading is more commonly spelled as {{ja-l|草鞋}}. See that entry for more detail.

====Pronunciation====
